theorem P3_union_of_dense_left {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hDense : closure (A : Set X) = (Set.univ : Set X)) :
    Topology.P3 (A ∪ B) := by
  -- First, establish that `A ∪ B` is dense.
  have hDenseUnion : closure (A ∪ B : Set X) = (Set.univ : Set X) := by
    -- Since `closure A = univ` and `closure A ⊆ closure (A ∪ B)`, we have
    -- the inclusion `univ ⊆ closure (A ∪ B)`.
    have h_subset : (Set.univ : Set X) ⊆ closure (A ∪ B : Set X) := by
      have h_closure_mono :
          closure (A : Set X) ⊆ closure (A ∪ B : Set X) :=
        closure_mono (Set.subset_union_left : (A : Set X) ⊆ A ∪ B)
      simpa [hDense] using h_closure_mono
    -- The reverse inclusion is immediate.
    have h_superset : closure (A ∪ B : Set X) ⊆ (Set.univ : Set X) :=
      Set.subset_univ _
    exact subset_antisymm h_subset h_superset
  -- Apply the density lemma to obtain `P3` for `A ∪ B`.
  exact
    (Topology.P3_of_dense (X := X) (A := A ∪ B) hDenseUnion)

theorem P1_union_three {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B C : Set X} :
    Topology.P1 A → Topology.P1 B → Topology.P1 C → Topology.P1 (A ∪ B ∪ C) := by
  intro hA hB hC
  -- First, combine `A` and `B` using the existing two‐set union lemma.
  have hAB : Topology.P1 (A ∪ B) :=
    Topology.P1_union (X := X) (A := A) (B := B) hA hB
  -- Next, unite the result with `C`.
  have hABC : Topology.P1 ((A ∪ B) ∪ C) :=
    Topology.P1_union (X := X) (A := A ∪ B) (B := C) hAB hC
  -- Use associativity of `∪` to rewrite the goal.
  simpa [Set.union_assoc] using hABC
